instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study on evaluating the quality of ready-to-eat pineapple?
Output: The study used Fourier-transform infrared, fluorescence (FLUO), and visible sensors, as well as the Videometer instrument to acquire spectral data for evaluating the quality of ready-to-eat pineapple.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to assess the predictive power of different analytical platforms coupled with machine learning algorithms in the related study on evaluating the quality of ready-to-eat pineapple?

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the predictive models of ready-to-eat pineapple in the related study on evaluating the quality of ready-to-eat pineapple and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the predictive models of ready-to-eat pineapple was the root mean square error of prediction (RMSE).
